Package exam

Class PharmacyService

  • java.lang.Object
    • exam.PharmacyService
  • @Component
public class PharmacyService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the methods used by the controller or the service itself to manage the filters.

      • localize

        public java.util.Vector<Pharmacy> localize​(double x,
                                           double y,
                                           double range)
        Filters the pharmacies returning only the ones within a certain range from a specified point described by x and y.
        Note: latitude and longitude are GPS coordinates so it is needed a specific formula to calculate the distance between them.
        Parameters:
        x - longitude of the centre
        y - latitude of the centre
        range - radius of the area searched
        Returns:
        temp vector made of all the pharmacies in the specified area

      • check

        public static boolean check​(java.lang.Object pharmacyValue,
                            java.lang.String operator,
                            java.lang.Object inputValue)
        Method used by the main filter that checks whether the value in the dataset respects the conditions imposed by the operator and the input value.
        Parameters:
        pharmacyValue - value in the dataset
        operator - it can be (==,>,<,<=,>=)
        inputValue - value in the input JSON
        Returns:
        false or true depending of the result of the comparison

      • filter

        public java.util.Vector<Pharmacy> filter​(java.util.Vector<Pharmacy> pharmacies,
                                         FilterParameters param)
        Filters the pharmacies and returns only those that meet the conditions of the input value and the operator. It uses the method check to verify the conditions.
        Parameters:
        pharmacies - the whole dataset. It is needed in order to have the possibility to iterate the process giving another Vector already filtered as input.
        fieldName - the field to compare
        operator - the arithmetical operator
        inputValue - the value wrote by the user in the JSON body
        Returns:
        temp vector made by the parmacies that met the conditions

      • isValidDate

        public static boolean isValidDate​(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if the input String is a valid Date that respects the format.
        Parameters:
        str -
        Returns:
        true if the string is a valid date with "dd/MM/yyyy" format, otherwise it returns false

        public static java.util.Date stringToDate​(java.lang.String str)
